intro: Ternstroemia meiocarpa, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a velvety texture. Ternstroemia meiocarpa is typically found in forest understories and thrives in humid, shaded environments.
